page.title: 01Stoney Cross New Forest
page.content: An area of open health and grasland with plantations of deciduous and coniferous trees with some evergreens traverse by trunk from from London to the West. it is Crown Land largly kept as a nature reserve jointly administrered by the Forestry commission, who grown, cut and sell timber, and the Verderers, a doby partly appointed and partly elected. Agisters look after the cattle and ponies turned out by commoners under ancient rights. The animals are rounded up annually for branding, collection of fees, removal or sale. Residents are mainly Commoners, small farmers, commutors to nearby towns, and retired people. Houses range from 16th century thatched cottages to present day houses. Caravan parks cater for tourists, and car parks accomodate visiting motorists.
